segment.source: This topic describes how to hide the BitLocker Drive Encryption Control Panel item, which appears by default on Control Panel as part of the Windows operating system.
segment.target: This topic describes how to hide the BitLocker Drive Encryption Control Panel item, which appears by default on Control Panel as part of the Windows operating system.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) creates an additional, custom Control Panel item, called BitLocker Encryption Options, which enables end users to manage their PIN and password, turn on BitLocker for a drive, and check encryption.
segment.target: Microsoft BitLocker Administration and Monitoring (MBAM) creates an additional, custom Control Panel item, called BitLocker Encryption Options, which enables end users to manage their PIN and password, turn on BitLocker for a drive, and check encryption.

segment.target: Manage BitLocker shortcut menu that appears when you right-click a drive in Windows Explorer

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Do not change the Group Policy settings in the BitLocker Drive Encryption node.
segment.target: Do not change the Group Policy settings in the BitLocker Drive Encryption node.

segment.source: If you do, MBAM will not work correctly.
segment.target: If you do, MBAM will not work correctly.

segment.source: When you configure the Group Policy settings in the MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management) node, MBAM automatically configures the BitLocker Drive Encryption settings for you.
segment.target: When you configure the Group Policy settings in the MDOP MBAM (BitLocker Management) node, MBAM automatically configures the BitLocker Drive Encryption settings for you.

segment.source: To hide the default BitLocker Drive Encryption item in Control Panel
segment.target: To hide the default BitLocker Drive Encryption item in Control Panel

segment.source: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or in Advanced Group Policy Management, browse to User configurationPoliciesAdministrative TemplatesControl Panel.
segment.target: In the Group Policy Management Console (GPMC) or in Advanced Group Policy Management, browse to User configurationPoliciesAdministrative TemplatesControl Panel.

segment.source: In the Details pane, double-click Hide specified Control Panel items, and then click Enabled.
segment.target: In the Details pane, double-click Hide specified Control Panel items, and then click Enabled.

segment.source: Click Show, click Add, and then type Microsoft.BitLockerDriveEncryption.
segment.target: Click Show, click Add, and then type Microsoft.BitLockerDriveEncryption.
